ygData.subject: Bugs of note for BloomUriUniqFilter users
ygData.msgSnippet: If you are Heritrix user running crawls with the (non-default) BloomUriUniqFilter option (as the frontier s alreadyIncluded structure), there are a couple of

Subject: Bugs of note for BloomUriUniqFilter users
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=Sp6bHSfzbzI7s89K81X0bp7rqemBWW_vnBEzCEBR_LkZ
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

If you are Heritrix user running crawls with the (non-default) 
BloomUriUniqFilter option (as the frontier's 'alreadyIncluded' 
structure), there are a couple of recent bugs affecting H1 through 
1.14.4 and H3 through 3.0.0 you should be aware of:

HER-1786 BloomFilter32bitSplit (default in H1) breaks for bitfields > 512MiB
https://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER-1786

HER-1783 BloomFilter64bit bit-length bug prevents full bitfield from 
being used; premature saturation
https://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER-1783

In a nutshell for H1 users (HER-1786):

If you're using BloomUriUniqFilter *and* have increased the size so the 
internal bitfield is larger than 512MiB (which is uncommon and 
inconvenient to do, as it requires changing system properties), that 
extra-large bloom filter will not be performing properly -- it will have 
much worse false-positive behavior, after a much-smaller number of 
inserts, because of an int/long problem in the internally-generated hash 
values.

Current auto-builds have been fixed, and the eventual 1.14.5 release 
(date uncertain) won't have the problem.

If in H1 you're not using BloomUriUniqFilter, or haven't tried to use a 
larger-than-default filter, you're not affected.

In a nutshell for H3 users (HER-1783):

Different but similar problems affected even the default-sized internal 
bloom filter used by BloomUriUniqFilter -- so any use would see much, 
much higher false-positive rates -- approaching 100% even before 
reaching the configured-at-instantiation number-of-inserts.

Current auto-builds have been fixed, and the eventual 3.0.1 release 
(date uncertain) won't have the problem.

The fix(es):

The myriad of investigational BloomFilter implementations that 
previously existed have been consolidated into one better-tested 
implementation class, BloomFilter64bit, that supports bitfields through 
any conceivable heap size.

The number of ongoing crawls affected by this may very well be "zero" 
but I wanted to highlight the risk and fixes just in case.

- Gordon @ IA
